page.title: 18THE WATER TOWER.
page.content: The tower at Berry Hill was constructed in 1926 to meet the demand of the area.It held 60,000 gallons of water.A diesel driven pump pumped water from the adjoining reservoir into the water tower. In 1953 electrically driven pumps replaced the old ones.A larger electrically driven pump was installed in 1959,making it possible to fill the tower at night using cheaper electricity.The smaller '1953' pump was used in the daytime. In 1970 the water tower was taken out of use.Finally,in 1985 ,it was taken down because it was in a dangerous state.It took twelve weeks to demolish.The main section was dismantled on the 18th of April 1985.
